medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe bilateral primary aldosteronism (PA) refractory to medical therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 48-year-old man, has an 11-year history of hypertension, diagnosed at the age of 31. Initially treated with hydrochlorothiazide and amlodipine, he exhibited normalized blood pressure prior to age 31. Hypokalemia occurred following medication initiation, which normalized with potassium supplementation. After four years of treatment with eplerenone, worsening hypertension and hypokalemia were noted, leading to surgical intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension for 11 years, with initial diagnosis at age 31. Past treatment included hydrochlorothiazide, amlodipine, and eplerenone.
